stocks.impact_theory: Carvana reported Q4 revenue of $5.6B beating estimates but adjusted EBITDA missed at $511M vs $539M expected, with vague 2026 guidance citing no sales forecast but long-term goal of 3M cars by 2035. Economic implications include concerns over used car market softening and high debt ($5.5B). Market psychology shifted to skepticism on profitability sustainability amid high multiples. Historical parallel: 2022 bankruptcy fears led to 97% drop; recovered on restructuring. Analogies: Like a sprinter burning out mid-race (strong growth but margins collapsing); rubber band stretched too far snapping back.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: EBITDA miss and lack of clear guidance overshadowed revenue beat; X sentiment negative with fraud allegations resurfacing; web news highlights Wall St cuts to PTs (JPM $490 from $510).

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Avoid; short-term rebound to $380 (+10%) if dip buyers enter
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Short with target $300 (-13%), potential 15% gains on further misses
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Unexpected used car demand surge; insider buying signals; broader market rally.

stocks.justification: Direct earnings reaction with high volume confirms sentiment shift; multiple analyst downgrades.

stocks.impact_theory: DoorDash Q4 earnings missed but Q1 forecast strong with delivery demand fueling growth; investments in AI/tech paying off. Econ impl: Resilient consumer spending on convenience amid inflation. Psych: Relief rally on visibility. Historical: Post-IPO volatility but up 200%+ on growth. Analogies: Caterpillar turning into butterfly (investments maturing); snowball rolling downhill (GOV growth accelerating).

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Premarket +11% on upbeat guidance; Deutsche Bank buy reaffirm; X buzz positive on expansion.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Long targeting $210 (+13%), 20% upside on sustained growth
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Avoid; downside to $170 (-8%) on margin pressure
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Increased competition from Uber Eats; economic slowdown hitting orders.

stocks.justification: Clear guidance beat expectations; analyst support strong.

stocks.impact_theory: Deere Q1 EPS $2.42 beat $1.92, revenue up 13%; FY26 guidance holds at cycle bottom. Econ: Ag sector resilient despite headwinds. Psych: Beat-and-raise confidence boost. Historical: Similar beats in 2021 led to 50% rallies. Analogies: Tractor plowing through mud (resilient in downturn); phoenix rising from inventory ashes.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Record high close; X posts highlight PEG candle; transcripts show optimism.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Long to $720 (+10%), potential 15% on ag rebound
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Short to $600 (-8%) if recession hits farms
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Commodity price drops; China trade tensions.

stocks.justification: Earnings beat with volume surge; historical patterns supportive.

stocks.impact_theory: OXY Q4 adj EPS $0.31 beat $0.18; $5.8B debt cut, div hike; capex efficient 2026 guide. Econ: Oil rally on Iran tensions. Psych: Buffett backing implied. Historical: Post-Anadarko recovery. Analogies: Debt snowball melting (balance sheet cleanup); oil well gusher (efficient production).

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Best day in year; debt tender; X options flow bullish.

stocks.justification: Strong fundamentals but oil volatility tempers.

stocks.impact_theory: WMT Q4 beat: rev $190.7B, EPS $0.75; FY26 guide 3.5-4.5% sales cautious. Econ: Value retail thrives in uncertainty. Psych: Sandbagging seen as conservative. Historical: Similar guides led to beats. Analogies: Steady ship in storm; elephant slow but unstoppable.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Recovered from initial dip; CFO hints raise guide; Amazon sales overtake but WMT e-comm strong.

stocks.justification: Mixed reaction but positive analyst spin.
